channel.title: Dave's linkblog feed
channel.description: My linkblog has been around in various locations for many years.

item.description: Gen. McMaster‚Äôs blistering account of the Trump White House.
item.source:markdown: Gen. McMaster‚Äôs blistering account of the Trump White House.

item.description: Imagine Harris saying "If the press says we're bad you know that means we're good." She could say that in her big interview. üòÄ
item.source:markdown: Imagine Harris saying "If the press says we're bad you know that means we're good." She could say that in her big interview. üòÄ

item.description: Greg Sargent interview with James Carville -- lots of insight.
item.source:markdown: Greg Sargent interview with James Carville -- lots of insight.

item.description: "Whenever I, or someone else, posts a link to this blog on Mastodon, it DDoS's me and brings the site down for a couple minutes."
item.source:markdown: "Whenever I, or someone else, posts a link to this blog on Mastodon, it DDoS's me and brings the site down for a couple minutes."

item.description: I learned that there were hippie programmers, who loved programming the way hippies love acid rock, weed, making love not war, patchouli oil, The Dead, getting back to the land, saying truth to power, sticking it to the man, etc etc.
item.source:markdown: I learned that there were hippie programmers, who loved programming the way hippies love acid rock, weed, making love not war, patchouli oil, The Dead, getting back to the land, saying truth to power, sticking it to the man, etc etc.

item.description: Why do we have to keep getting COVID?
item.source:markdown: Why do we have to keep getting COVID?

item.description: People have been saying that podcasting is dead or Spotify is gonna own it or Google‚Äôs gonna own it or who knows and podcasting keeps on going just fine.
item.source:markdown: People have been saying that podcasting is dead or Spotify is gonna own it or Google‚Äôs gonna own it or who knows and podcasting keeps on going just fine.

item.description: I'm going to have to delete all these test posts. First thing tomorrow. :-)

item.description: A lot of new in-car tech is ‚Äúnot necessary,‚Äù survey finds.

item.description: The NYT isn't trying to make us love Trump, that's impossible. But they are trying to make us not fall in love with Harris.
item.source:markdown: The NYT isn't trying to make us love Trump, that's impossible. But they are trying to make us not fall in love with Harris.

item.description: Imagine the NYT were narrating this moment. When we win they don't report it.
item.source:markdown: Imagine the NYT were narrating this moment. When we win they don't report it.

item.description: "We suspect Trump‚Äôs team has not even told their boss about this dispute because it would be too embarrassing to admit they don‚Äôt think he can handle himself.."
item.source:markdown: "We suspect Trump‚Äôs team has not even told their boss about this dispute because it would be too embarrassing to admit they don‚Äôt think he can handle himself.."

item.description: The NYT et al aren't even doing a fair job of covering the election as a horserace, because they're making sure it's a virtual tie, so even if our team has overwhelming power...
item.source:markdown: The NYT et al aren't even doing a fair job of covering the election as a horserace, because they're making sure it's a virtual tie, so even if our team has overwhelming power...

item.description: The Twitter API still works. It is useful for cross-posting, but not easily incorporated into indie developer's products, but useful for individuals with developer accounts.
item.source:markdown: The Twitter API still works. It is useful for cross-posting, but not easily incorporated into indie developer's products, but useful for individuals with developer accounts.

item.title: Don't feed the troll
item.description: Trump says abortion legislation should be left to states.

item.description: "We have no visibility into the inner workings of the NYT. We can't vote them out of office. We can't even rebut them. They rarely carry opposing opinions."
item.source:markdown: "We have no visibility into the inner workings of the NYT. We can't vote them out of office. We can't even rebut them. They rarely carry opposing opinions."

item.description: Walt Mossberg: "Journalists have one core job: to tell the truth, especially when it‚Äôs clear. The staff of the NY Times has done it in the past, even at great risk. Why don‚Äôt they do it now?"
item.source:markdown: Walt Mossberg: "Journalists have one core job: to tell the truth, especially when it‚Äôs clear. The staff of the NY Times has done it in the past, even at great risk. Why don‚Äôt they do it now?"

item.description: Interview with Kamala Harris's aunt in India. Really interesting. Her mother came to the US on a Fullbright scholarship.

item.description: I‚Äôve watched Michelle Obama ask dozens of times who‚Äôs gonna tell Trump that the job he‚Äôs seeking might just be one of them black jobs and it makes me laugh every damn time.

item.description: Trump is not the incumbent, but it might feel that way because the coup that started on Jan 6 is ongoing. It won't be over until there is a peaceful transfer of power from Biden to Harris and Trump is out of the picture.
item.source:markdown: Trump is not the incumbent, but it might feel that way because the coup that started on Jan 6 is ongoing. It won't be over until there is a peaceful transfer of power from Biden to Harris and Trump is out of the picture.

item.description: Beware the Pundit-Brained Version of the Democratic Convention. This is the other must-read piece, again required reading for the op-ed writers at the NYT. This is how we see you, and why 90% of the opinion pieces in the NYT are worse than worthless.
item.source:markdown: Beware the Pundit-Brained Version of the Democratic Convention. This is the other must-read piece, again required reading for the op-ed writers at the NYT. This is how we see you, and why 90% of the opinion pieces in the NYT are worse than worthless.

item.description: If you have some time this weekend, this is one of two pieces every informed person should read and take in. And every NYT op-ed writer should take it in too, this should be the subtext in any piece you write about the election.
item.source:markdown: If you have some time this weekend, this is one of two pieces every informed person should read and take in. And every NYT op-ed writer should take it in too, this should be the subtext in any piece you write about the election.

item.description: If you believe the NYT fact check that says Trump is a billionaire, here‚Äôs how you can be one too. Buy two shares of any stock, sell one share to your kid brother for a $500 million IOU. Voila! You are now a billionaire in the same sense Trump is, according to the NYT. üòÄ
